title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire Friday 28 October 2016 - BBC News
summary: diet pills that killed shrewsbury student still being sold on `` dark web '' .
residents near ditherington flax mill consider appealing against its development .
plans to transform shrewsbury 's old prison are put on hold .

documents.title: your west midlands questions answered
text: your west midlands questions answered

documents.title: southend united 1-1 shrewsbury town
text: southend united 1-1 shrewsbury town

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening .
plus do n't forget that the clocks will be going back on sunday , 30 october at 02:00 .

documents.title: watch : shropshire 's weekend weather forecast
text: here 's a look ahead to what 's in store on saturday and sunday .
you can also find the latest weather forecasts on the bbc weather website at any other time .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : salmon leap on river severn
text: salmon tend to head up river at the same time very year to spawn .
this was the scene at the weir in shrewsbury in october 2015 .

documents.title: your photos : salmon leaping at shrewsbury weir
text: thanks to dave james for sharing these amazing photos of salmon leaping last weekend .
we 're keen to see your photos of salmon as they head up the river severn to their spawning grounds .
quick check of # shrewsburyweir this am already # salmon are jumping @ twitterid @ twitterid low water will make them leap # spawningwatch
amazing sight last saturday seeing # salmon leaping at weir

documents.title: history group remembers role of black soldiers in world war one
text: telford 's black history group is hoping to educate the next generation on the role that black soldiers played in world war one .
they 've been investigating the role played by lionel turpin and walter tull , two soldiers killed on the western front .
we 're trying to educate and provide information to members of the public , so that they have an idea of what black people did in the war .
mainly for the young black people in the country . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police tweetathon continues
text: west mercia police have passed 500 incidents for the day .
the force is continuing its 24-hour tweetathon giving an insight into the 999 and 101 calls they deal with .
follow them here .
( 532 ) silent 999 call - 2 year old playing with a phone - advice was given # opprotect
( 420 ) weapon found by resident in garden of private property in # shrewsbury # opprotect

documents.title: police boss calls for body cameras for officers
text: the west mercia police and crime commissioner john campion says he wants officers in the region to be given body-worn cameras .
the cameras would gather evidence as the officer works , and are aimed at changing offender behaviour .
several other forces , including staffordshire police and the metropolitan force , already use the technology .

documents.title: latest : 'disappointment ' over pool closure ; diet pills for sale on the web ; low police morale
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in shropshire :
- council group leader `` disappointed '' pool closure plans are still being considered
- diet pills that caused the death of a 21-year-old girl from shropshire are being sold on `` hidden '' parts of the internet
- one police officer in 10 say they 're considering leaving the west mercia force in the next two years
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire service calls for sprinkler systems to be installed in all new buildings
text: shropshire 's fire service is backing calls for sprinkler systems to be installed in all new buildings .
it 's hosting a `` sprinklers seminar '' at shrewsbury town 's stadium on tuesday and say it 's expecting over 80 people to turn up .
the fire service described sprinklers as being `` like having a firefighter on permanent standby in every room '' and points out that in wales sprinklers are already compulsory in new buildings .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: clifton cinema campaign : new fundraising scheme launched
text: campaigners trying to bring a cinema to a town have launched another fundraising scheme to help move plans forward .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: relationships counselling charity relate closes in shropshire
text: a shrewsbury-based organisation that offers relationship counselling and support has closed .
relate shropshire , herefordshire and north staffordshire was part of a federation of 50 groups linked with the national charity .
seventy two jobs are expected to go across the three counties .
a spokeswoman blamed financial difficulties and thanked staff , counsellors , trustees , volunteers and supporters , for what she called their `` amazing '' work over the years .
relate , nationally , says it 's assessing how demand for services in the local area can best be met in future .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : autumn in shropshire
text: you 've been sending us your photos of shropshire bathed in autumn sunshine and acorns !
if you 've got you 'd like the share with the rest of the county you can email them to us , tweet or get in touch via our facebook page .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: shrewsbury swimming pool plans 'fair '
text: shropshire council 's scrutiny committee was looking today at whether it was fair for the authority to give people 12 months to put together a business plan to keep swimming facilities at the quarry .
shropshire council has said its preferred option is to build a new pool and leisure centre out-of-town at sundorne - a decision that 's attracted a lot of criticism from local residents .
today 's committee has now decided that the option offered by the council to give those who want to keep the pool at the quarry 12 months to put together a case , was fair .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest : calls to look again shrewsbury pool are rejected ; diet pills that killed shrewsbury teenager still being sold on the net
text: the top stories in shropshire this afternoon :
- calls for a rethink on plans to build to build a new pool outside of shrewsbury are turned down
diet pills that killed a shrewsbury teenager are still being sold on `` hidden '' parts of the internet
- morale among police officers in west mercia is improving , but three quarters of officers say it 's still a problem in the force
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrews defender dom smith back back in town
text: shrewsbury town 's dom smith says he bears no grudges against the club 's former manager micky mellon for sending him out on loan to barrow .
smith has been brought back early by new boss , paul hurst , and is determined to prove his worth .
he [ mellon ] gave me my league debut and he put a lot of trust in me , last season , even when we were fighting to stay up .
i 'll always have a massive respect for him .
it was n't my decision to go on loan , but it 's done me the world of good .
i 'm happy i went on loan , but disappointed that i could n't contribute to my side here . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police tweetathon : missing boy in whitchurch and fraud in bridgnorth
text: west mercia police have logged more than 300 incidents so far today via their 101 and 999 call centres .
the force 's 24-hour tweetathon shows a variety of crimes being reported
( 296 ) reports of fraud at # bridgnorth # opprotect
( 307 ) missing person report of teenage boy at # whitchurch railway station # opprotect
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: work continues in building biomass boiler house at attingham park
text: you can see construction of the new reception and boiler house at attingham park is well under way .
work continues on 'the stables : reworking a grand design ' .
new reception and biomass boiler house in progress , info
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: environment agency gearing up for autumn flooding
text: the environment agency has been checking everything is ready to go , in preparation for autumn flooding .
they 've been testing flood defences at frankwell and working with the army and severn trent in putting up demountable barriers .
residents in ironbridge are looking at setting up their own action group to manage flood risks .
they noticed some of the gulleys were blocked on jiggers bank , so they mapped it all and gave it to the agency , who we 're told have taken action .
chris bainger , from the environment agency , says they 're also mounting a campaign on social media to alert 18-34-year-olds about the risk of flooding .
the group that we 've identified that do n't pay or heed any attention is the 18-34-year-olds .
so it 's working with them and raising awareness .
your property may not flood , but your route to work may flood .
so it 's about being prepared .
where will you park your car ? ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: plans to reform shrewsbury 's prison put on hold
text: plans to transform shrewsbury 's old prison into housing , shops and restaurants have been put on hold , because of fears about traffic , parking and development .
councillors have decided to look again at the issue - when revised plans are put forward .
it means the prison tours and zombie challenges at the dana will continue until at least the end of next year .
as well as the tours , we 're able to do more of our events , so next year we have huge plans for halloween .
we 've got so many plans and now we 're able to do it for another year .
it 's just fantastic . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire football preview on facebook live
text: watch the bbc shropshire sports team as they preview shrewsbury , telford and tns 's matches this weekend .
the facebook live broadcast is just getting under way .

documents.title: police tweetathon : 999 abuse
text: not every 999 call is a genuine emergency it seems .
999 call .
woman saying she did n't have an emergency , swore at the call handler and hung up .
# opprotect

documents.title: previewing the weekend 's big games
text: shropshire 's sport team discuss the weekend 's big games live on facebook live at 13:15 .
watch the team as they preview matches featuring shrewsbury town , afc telford and the new saints .

documents.title: telford mp backs moves to improve the way homeless people are looked after
text: telford 's conservative mp lucy allan is supporting the homeless reduction bill which has its second reading in parliament today .

under current rules , only single mothers and fathers , those with mental health issues or victims of domestic violence and former servicemen and women , can go to the front of the queue for housing assistance .
but bob blackman , the tory mp for harrow east , wants to place a new duty on councils to house every homeless person within 56 days .
follow live updates on the debate here
pleased to be supporting today 's # homelessnessreductionbill in parliament
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest : relationship counselling service relate closes
text: the top stories in shropshire this lunchtime :
relationship counselling charity relate closes in shropshire
- the 2016 poppy appeal launches in telford
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : weather forecast
text: any light rain should clear to leave things mainly dry but overcast with highsof 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: salmon leaping the weir in shrewsbury on the way to their spawning grounds
text: salmon have already been spotted leaping the weir in shrewsbury on the way to their spawning grounds .
chris bainger from the environment agency says the salmon are struggling a bit as river levels are low because of a lack of a rain .
we 'd love to see any you might have of the salmon leaping .
you can email us , tweet or get in touch via our facebook page
quick check of # shrewsburyweir this am already # salmon are jumping @ twitterid @ twitterid low water will make them leap # spawningwatch
@ chrisbaingerea @ twitterid @ twitterid saw quite a few at diglis # worcester yesterday .
cheers dave i had heard from tony that you saw a few could be leaping for a while if no rain
i keep meaning to visit this place
jack you will always be welcome there 's a lot of fish to film .
the project on the severn sounds fantastic so let me know if i can help in any way
amazing sight last saturday seeing # salmon leaping at weir
on getting shad back in the river what about the salmon oh i forgot hatcheries do n't work just look at the tyne
from you actually running the severn hatchery for salmon years ago you are now against it what has made you change
there would be a lot more to see if you opened up the hatcheries instead of pissing away money
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: poppy appeal launched in telford
text: the 2016 poppy appeal has been launched in telford .
the royal british legion is calling on members of the public to recognise younger veterans and serving soldiers .
the charity says people commonly associate remembrance and the poppy with older , world war two veterans .
2016 # poppyappeal launched in telford - # rethinkremembrance :

documents.title: morale improved in west mercia police force
text: earlier we highlighted a report by the police federation which looked at the morale of officers .
the latest figures released actually show an improvement in morale within the force , rather than a decline .
last year , 63.8 % of officers said they had low personal morale .
this year , that dropped to just 44.3 % .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police tweetathon : calls coming in from across force area
text: so far many of today 's 999 and 101 calls being made to west mercia police seem to be concerns for people 's safety and welfare , with calls coming in from market drayton , redditch , telford and ludlow , among others
this graphic gives you some idea of the size of the area the forces cover .
( 133 ) concern for safety , five attempts to contact police from same number in # redditch # opprotect0
( 117 ) significant number of officers dealing with concern for safety in # telford # opprotect

documents.title: latest : police morale rock bottom in latest survey ; residents set to appeal flax mill renovation
text: the top stories in shropshire this morning :
- morale among officers at west mercia police is near rock bottom , according to police federation
- diet pills that killed a shrewsbury student are still being sold on `` hidden '' parts of the internet
- residents living near the flax mill in shrewsbury may appeal against its development
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrewsbury town manager aims to create more attacking side
text: the new shrewsbury town manager paul hurst says the squad he 's inherited might be a bit short of numbers for the style he wants to play .
he is looking to make them a more attacking side , but says do n't expect a huge change overnight .
i ca n't play how i 'd really like to , that 's an honest assessment of it .
i like wingers and it 's something we have n't got an abundance of here .
the obvious one is injured , the other one is a young player that 's been brought in , but i think has found life difficult here so far .
and perhaps junior brown is the other one that can play there , but is needed at left back as well . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: west mercia police launch 24-hour tweetathon
text: west mercia police is tweeting details of every 999 and 101 call over the next 24 hours .
we 'll be bringing you a flavour of them through the day , but you can follow them on twitter .
( 118 ) complaint against police in # hereford # opprotect
( 110 ) officers attending sus man in van # shrewsbury # opprotect
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 72 jobs lost as charity branch goes into liquidation
text: a charity that has helped thousands experiencing relationship problems has gone into liquidation , with the loss of 72 jobs .
author: Bridgnorth Journal

documents.title: residents near flax mill consider appeal against revamp
text: some people living near the historic flax mill in shrewsbury say they 'll consider appealing against its renovation .
full planning permission for the scheme was granted yesterday - so work can start on creating a visitor centre , cafe and offices .
one local resident we spoke to said local people were worried they will `` lose their privacy and peace and quiet '' .
they said the redevelopment would cause `` noise pollution , contamination '' and said `` none of their concerns had been addressed '' .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest : lethal diet pills still for sale on internet ; anger for some over flax mill renovation
text: the top stories in shropshire this morning :
- diet pills that killed a shrewsbury student are still being sold on `` hidden '' parts of the internet
- residents living near the flax mill are considering appealing against its development
- plans to transform shrewsbury 's old prison are put on hold
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

text: a cloudy and occasionally drizzly start to the day but any light rain will clear leaving things mainly dry but overcast with highs of 15c ( 59f ) .

BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : heavy traffic on one or two roads may delay your journey
text: there are no major accidents to report on the roads this morning , but heavy traffic on some routes may affect your journey .
there 's congestion on the a5112 battlefield road in shrewsbury at the junction with featherbed lane .
traffic is also heavy on the a49 bromfield road in both directions in ludlow at the b4365 junction in the roadworks .
author: BBC Travel

text: i 'm here with all of your news , sport , travel and weather updates this morning .
do get in touch if you have a story or photos you 'd like to share .
you can email , tweet or get in touch via our facebook page .

text: 'lethal ' dnp diet pills still on sale

text: diet pill death student honoured by uni

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : cloudy and mild this evening and overnight
text: it 's going to remain overcast and mild this evening and overnight .
tomorrow we could see the cloud get thicker .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: applications to hold weddings at football stadium
text: from next may you should be able to tie the knot at shrewsbury town football club , because it has applied to become a venue for civil wedding ceremonies .
the plan is to hold them in a room at the stadium , not on the pitch .
the application is open to consultation until mid-november .

documents.title: fire service backs calls for sprinkler systems
text: shropshire 's fire services is backing calls for sprinkler systems to be installed in all new buildings .
it 's hosting a `` sprinklers seminar '' at shrewsbury town 's stadium on tuesday and say it 's expecting more than 80 people to turn up .
the fire service described sprinklers as being `` like having a firefighter on permanent standby in every room '' and points out that in wales sprinklers are already compulsory in new buildings .
for many vulnerable people getting out of a room and away from a fire would be difficult , perhaps impossible .
even if they heard their smoke alarm it would n't help them escape from a fire .
sprinklers can reduce that danger by suppressing or putting out a fire and preventing it spreading from room to room , ''

documents.title: property developer killed in crash 'was n't wearing seatbelt '
text: a family today said the death of their father in a road accident illustrates the tragic consequences of not wearing a seatbelt .
author: Market Drayton Advertiser

documents.title: students asked to draw up plans for community centre
text: students are going to be asked to draw up plans for a redevelopment of the sutton hill community centre in telford .
it 's going to be run by a local charity from next april , after telford and wrekin said if could n't afford to fund it .
the authority says the building is almost 50 years old and in need of some refurbishment .
the university of wolverhampton has already worked on plans for the anstice centre in madeley , so the council has called on it again for this job .
the students have been onsite , met staff and public users of the facilities .
i 'm very much looking forward to seeing their ideas develop , with the goal of creating an integrated building design and a welcoming facility in the heart of sutton hill . ''

documents.title: headlines : flax mill development to go ahead ; fire service sprinklers call ; firearms licencing delays
text: our headlines this evening :
- multimillion-pound redevelopment of shrewsbury flax mill gets the go-ahead
- fire service backing calls for sprinklers in all new buildings
- firearms licencing taking up to a year in west mercia area
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: firearms licencing taking up to a year
text: it 's taking anything up to a year to get a firearms licence in the west mercia area , as the force works to upgrade its record-keeping .
the force has explained it is modernising and moving from a paper-based system to an electronic one , but said `` it is not something that happens overnight '' .
it says that police staff were working as quickly as possible to meet the `` high volume of work coming into them '' and expected to reduce the waiting period in time .

documents.title: not everyone happy with shrewsbury flax mill plans
text: shrewsbury 's flax mill has been closed for 30 years now , so the decision to grant permission for a major redevelopment will be welcomed by many .
but , some ditherington residents at the shropshire council meeting said afterwards they had concerns about traffic and parking and those same concerns were raised by councillor andrew bannerman .
in the end the plans were approved - but only just , by six votes to four .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury-telford clash postponed
text: next tuesday 's shropshire senior cup final between shrewsbury town and afc telford united has been called off .
it 's because shrewsbury 's under-18s have a home tie in the fa youth cup to play and the rules say the home team 's senior pitch must be used .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your questions : what do we know about oakengates nissen huts ?
text: john cosh went to the your questions section of our website to ask : `` do you know the history of 'the camp ' , a number of tin nissen huts on the a5 at limekiln bank , st georges ? ''
and he adds that he lived there in 1945 .
we went to a local historian , phil fairclough , for this one .

he has done a lot of work to research the history of camps like this and says it was originally used to house italian prisoners of war , but after italy left the war in 1943 they were gradually released .
he believes the huts at oakengates were then donated by the army to local people who had been left without homes and has seen a photograph of one of the families moving in .
if you have a question you 'd like us to take a look at , get in touch .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fraudsters left shropshire dog rescue charity on brink of closure
text: fraudsters brought a shropshire dog rescue centre to the brink of closure , it was revealed today .
author: South Shropshire Journal

documents.title: headlines : flax mill plans approved ; more time for dana developer ; england star coaches in telford
text: a recap of our top stories this afternoon :
- plans for multimillion-pound redevelopment of shrewsbury 's flax mill
- more time given to dana prison developer
- over 70 girls at coaching session led by england 's jill scott
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: more time for prison developer
text: shropshire councillors have agreed to give a developer time to rework his plans for shrewsbury 's former dana prison .

trevor osborne wants to see the building turned into a mixture of housing , shops and restaurants , but has been facing opposition from critics who have raised concerns over traffic , parking and over-development .
mr osborne will now go away and try to answer some of those concerns .

documents.title: flax mill plans approved
text: shropshire councillors have approved plans to repair and restore parts of shrewsbury 's historic flax mill .
this is stage two of the project and it involves work on the main mill and kiln to provide a visitor centre , learning space and cafe on the ground floor .
the upper floors will be converted to provide office space .

documents.title: new flag to improve atmosphere at football ground
text: whitchurch alport hope their new club flag will make yockings park `` feel more like a football ground '' .
it was made in northern ireland and took two weeks to make and because of its size there are limits to where they can hang it .
the club says fans seem pleased with it and it is considering getting more .
you can see the flag when alport host maine road fc on saturday .
it 's a bit of a monster and you ca n't hang it up everywhere - so there are limits to where we can position it .
at yockings park it 's fine , as we have some metal fencing in one of the corners and it 's a perfect fit . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel : accident causing delays at cockshutt
text: an accident is slowing things down on the a528 at cockshutt .
it 's affecting traffic in both directions .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: dana developer asks for more time
text: the developer who wants to transform shrewsbury 's old prison is asking for more time to work on his plans and answer concerns that have been raised .
the recommendation before councillors meeting this afternoon is to reject the osborne group 's plans for housing , shops and restaurants .
it 's because of fears over traffic , parking and over-development .

documents.title: watch : england midfielder passes on skills to girls in telford
text: more than 70 girls have been enjoying a bit of coaching with england midfielder jill scott in telford today .
the man city player has been running them through a number of drills at the sports dome at telford college of arts and technology .

documents.title: teenager charged after cannabis farm discovery
text: a 16-year-old has been charged over the discovery of a cannabis farm in oswestry .
police were called to an unoccupied house in beatrice street on tuesday where they found plants being grown .
the teenager has been charged with cultivating cannabis .

documents.title: ironbridge man celebrates his 100th birthday
text: a man from ironbridge is celebrating his 100th birthday today .
geoffrey hickman , who is also thought to be the oldest surviving member of the royal artillery from world war two , has lived all his life in the town .
and the abraham darby show band were there to mark the occasion .

documents.title: your photos : more of your of autumn around shropshire
text: while the weather is a bit grey , there 's plenty of colour around the county at the moment , and it 's being captured in the photos being sent in by our bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken near oswestry ( top ) and norton ( bottom )
if you 'd like to share your photos of the weather in shropshire , just head to the bbc weather watchers website and sign up .
we do n't need many details from you , but you 'll have to think of a nickname .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: on midlands today : woman pays for new wig salon for cancer patients
text: this lunchtime on midlands today , we 'll have more on a new hairdressing salon that has opened for cancer patients who 've lost their hair during treatment .
it provides wigs and was paid for by a woman who had cancer herself .
i 'll have more from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Sian Grzeszczyk
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shrewsbury politician one of several in the running to lead ukip
text: want to catch up with the latest on the ukip leadership race ?
suzanne evans is standing - she is the woman who stood for ukip in shrewsbury at the last election and she still owns a house in the town .
but the bbc has produced this guide to the other candidates .

documents.title: headlines : roundabout changes criticised ; funding for scheme to boost fish numbers ; ironbridge man 's 100th birthday
text: our top stories this lunchtime :
- criticism of shrewsbury roundabout redevelopment
- scheme to boost fish numbers in severn given £ 20m
- ironbridge man celebrates 100th birthday
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: plans for two iconic shrewsbury buildings go before councillors
text: redevelopment plans for two of shrewsbury 's best-known buildings will go before councillors today .
a report recommends they approve proposals to repair and restore the main mill and kiln at the flax mill , creating a visitor centre , cafe and office space .
but plans to turn the former dana prison into student accommodation , homes , shops , restaurants , businesses and a gym are likely to be turned down when they meet at 14:00 .

documents.title: weather : cloudy and relatively mild across shropshire this afternoon
text: its going to stay cloudy this afternoon , but temperatures will reach a relatively-mild 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: hair salon for cancer patients opens at hospital
text: a new hair and wig salon is being opened for cancer patients .
fiona ford , from woore , in shropshire , was diagnosed with the breast cancer in 2009 and says she was disappointed with the wigs available when she lost her own hair through treatment .
so she raised £ 50,000 to set up a centre at stafford 's county hospital to help others like her .
the university hospitals of north midlands nhs trust , which runs it , says patients can now have a one-to-one appointment with a wig fitter and choose from over 80 different wigs .
author: Sian Grzeszczyk
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: police reminder as bonfire night approaches
text: police in shrewsbury say they 've already had reports of fireworks being set off in a public place - which is against the law .
patrols are under way in the town with bonfire night just over a week away .
reports of fireworks being set off in castlefields in a public place last night .
you can be fined up to £ 5000 .
we are patrolling the area

documents.title: retired transport engineer not impressed by roundabout plans
text: a retired transport engineer , living in meole brace , says he 's not impressed by the changes being made to the roundabout there .
shropshire council starts work on the project , part of a larger £ 12m scheme , on monday with the aim of making it work better for motorists , cyclists and pedestrians .
retired engineer clive cross says the changes will do nothing to ease congestion there or in the town centre .

and he says it `` does nothing for pedestrians except lead them into a point of danger '' , claiming the crossing will be more dangerous in future , especially on match days , because it invites them to cross at a complicated section of the roundabout .
[ as it stands now ] it works very well in fact as roundabouts go , whoever laid this out in the first instance decades ago did rather a good job . ''

documents.title: your photos : autumn around shropshire
text: we seem to get some of our best at this time of year , when the leaves change colour and the weather gets a little more , interesting .
these ones were taken in bridgnorth ( above ) and on the ercall ( below ) .
if you 've got photos you want to share , you can get in touch via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: first look at new gp surgery
text: people living in whitchurch are being invited to look around the town 's new gp surgery , which opens next week in the local hospital .
the claypit street medical practice replaces the richmond house surgery , which is closing because the building is no longer available .
last month , campaigners marched through the town after previous plans collapsed at the last minute .
since then , county out-of-hours healthcare provider shropdoc agreed to run the practice - called claypit street - on a disused ward in the community hospital .
patient bookings start on wednesday .

documents.title: scheme to boost fish numbers given £ 20m
text: a £ 20m project has been launched to help boost fish numbers and tourism on the river severn .
several state-of-the-art fish-passes will be built , allowing some fish that are struggling to get past weirs to reach more suitable spawning grounds .
work will begin next year and the whole project , which will also benefit salmon and eel , is expected to take five years to complete .
it will help restore important fish stock to the upper river severn . ''

documents.title: headlines : thousands sign shrewsbury roundabout petition ; river severn scheme ; water company scam
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- meole brace roundabout petition to stop restructuring works signed by more than 3,000
- scheme to boost fish numbers given £ 20m
- severn trent water warns people to be aware of a scam after reports in oswestry
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: roundabout petition signed by thousands
text: a petition to stop shrewsbury 's meole brace roundabout from being restructured has reached more than 3,000 signatures .
shropshire council 's due to start the work , part of a £ 12m project , on monday to ease access for cars , cyclists and pedestrians .
critics say it 'll damage wildlife and make access for people walking nearby worse .
shropshire council says it 's aware of the petition to stop the roundabout being restructured .
it says there was a full consultation earlier this year and the reasons for the work are available online .

documents.title: water company warning after scam reports
text: water company severn trent is urging people to be aware of a scam after reports in oswestry .
people have received calls from a firm describing itself as the `` water board '' asking for access to their homes .
severn trent says customers should ring them ( 0345 604 1655 ) to check before letting workmen in .

documents.title: ice hockey : telford tigers 3-2 guildford flames
text: telford tigers had a dramatic 3-2 win over guildford flames last night .
victory at telford ice rink came after 60 minutes ended with the scores tied at 2-2 , before overtime and penalty shots finally handed the tigers an extra point .
tigers retain their three-point lead at the top of the english premier league , with second-placed milton keynes having also won last night .
tonight is the start of a tough slog for us , but good teams find a way and we found a way tonight . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: england star in shropshire today
text: one of the stars of the england women 's football team is training young hopefuls in telford today .
midfielder jill scott , who has more than 100 caps for england , was a key part of the side that reached the semi-finals at last summer 's world cup .
she 'll be at the sports dome at telford college of arts and technology from 10:00 .

documents.title: headlines : anger over meole brace roundabout changes ; river severn project ; new whitchurch gp surgery
text: our top stories this morning :
- a last-minute petition to try to stop roundabout works reaches more than 3,000 signatures
- £ 20m project launched to boost fish numbers and tourism for the river severn
- people living in whitchurch are being invited to look around the town 's new gp surgery
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : mild start to the day for october
text: staying dry today with some brighter spells this afternoon .
alex has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : slow traffic in market drayton
text: roadworks on the a53 are slowing traffic around market drayton at the a529 adderley road .
visit the bbc travel page for all the latest on the roads around shropshire .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: latest from bbc shropshire
text: good morning , i 'm in the bbc shropshire newsroom taking a look at the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 've got a story you think we should be mentioning you can get in touch via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: kitten trapped for 10 miles in engine
text: kitten trapped for 10 miles in engine

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : a sunny end to the day
text: we 're forecast a bit of sunshine to end the day , but it should cloud over again tonight .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: telford mp backing homelessness bill
text: the telford mp is backing a change in the law that would require councils to offer more help to the homeless .
lucy allan says poor housing is an issue for many in telford and help is n't available for people not deemed to be in a priority category .
ms allan says she will vote in favour of the homelessness reduction bill , when it has its second reading in parliament on friday .

documents.title: ex-army trainee put taxi driver in headlock during telford robbery
text: an ex-army trainee who robbed a telford taxi driver after grabbing him by the throat has been jailed for more than seven years .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: football : hurst to monitor loan strikers
text: shrewsbury town 's new manager paul hurst says he 's keeping a close eye on two young strikers - currently on loan elsewhere .
kaiman anderson is scoring lots of goals at halesowen town and ethan jones is at tranmere rovers .
hurst has already recalled dom smith from his spell at barrow and could do the same with these two .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : youngsters thanked for sharing their families with foster children
text: a group of children have been treated to a day out at blists hill victorian town today , to say thank you for sharing their parents with foster children .
the youngsters come from families who regularly look after other children and today 's event marks a month of events run by the fostering network called sons and daughters .
shirley wilson from telford and wrekin council told us it was good for them to get together too .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : hospital blames increasing demand for ambulance delays ; wellington arson attacks ; kitten rescued from car engine
text: our headlines this evening :
- hospital says increasing demand causing ambulance delays
- leaflet campaign after spate of arson attacks in wellington
- kitten rescued from car engine after 100-mile road-trip
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : draw made for shropshire premier cup
text: the draw has been made , live on bbc radio shropshire , for the shropshire premier cup .
and the holders , market drayton town , face a tricky tie at wem in this season 's quarter-finals .
whitchurch alport , top of the north west counties league first division , are at home to the lowest-ranked team left , alscott .
the other two ties will be haughmond v shawbury united , and newport town v fc oswestry .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: car set on fire in newport overnight
text: a car has been set on fire in newport overnight .
the fire service were called out just after midnight and took 20 minutes to put it out .
police are investigating .

documents.title: police crackdown on off-road bikes and quad-bikes
text: there will be extra police patrols in hadley and leegomery , after complaints about people using off-road motorbikes and quad-bikes .
the police say in one instance someone out walking a dog was nearly run-over .
the law says bikes can be seized if they 're used in an anti-social way .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : ex-shrewsbury midfielder wesolowski joins guiseley
text: james wesolowski has signed for national league side guiseley , after leaving shrewsbury town in the summer .
the 29-year-old australian made his debut against gateshead last night .
he made 26 league appearances in two seasons for shrewsbury .

documents.title: arrest after pensioner injured in attempted shropshire robbery
text: a 27-year-old man has been arrested in connection with an attempted robbery in market drayton .
author: Market Drayton Advertiser

documents.title: hospital responds to ambulance service concerns
text: the royal shrewsbury hospital has accepted that the delays faced by patients arriving by ambulance are not ideal and says it 's partly down to increased demand on its a & e department .

the hospital has the longest ambulance waiting times in the west midlands and the west midlands ambulance service says `` drastic action '' needs to be taken , or it may find it has no ambulances to respond to emergencies .

the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust says it is working to ensure patients are n't taking up an a & e bed if they do n't need one and admitted too many patients are facing delays before they can be discharged .
and it said it would discuss the issue again next week .

documents.title: headlines : call to reduce ambulance delays ; spate of bin fires ; kitten rescued from car engine
text: our headlines this afternoon include :
- ambulance service wants `` drastic action '' to reduce delays at shrewsbury hospital
- spate of bin fires in wellington over last 48 hours
- kitten rescued from car engine after 10-mile road-trip
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: spate of arson attacks in wellington
text: arsonists have targeted skips and wheelie bins in a spate of attacks in wellington
firefighters say they 're responded to 14 such incidents in the town over the past two days .
warning leaflets are being sent out to households try and prevent attacks .

documents.title: body cameras considered after increase in ambulance attacks
text: the number of assaults on ambulance crews in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire has gone up .
bosses are considering whether to issue body-worn cameras after hearing there were 32 assaults in the past six months .
that 's more than during the whole of last year .

documents.title: baby 's death could have been avoided , coroner rules
text: the death of a four-month-old baby could have been prevented had errors not been made during her birth at a hospital in shropshire , a coroner has ruled .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: your photos : thick cloud around shropshire
text: it seems to be clearing up a little now , but we 've seen some thick cloud around this morning .
the bbc weather watchers have been sharing photos like these , taken near church stretton ( top ) and broseley ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : demand for review into child sexual exploitation
text: on midlands today this lunchtime we 'll hear from one of the region 's mps who wants an independent review into child sexual exploitation in the town she represents .
there 's also news on 12 days of travel disruption for train passengers on one of the midlands routes .
plus we 'll hear from a syrian refugee who arrived in the west midlands in january who is hoping to realise his dream of becoming a professional footballer .
those stories and more along with your lunchtime weather forecasts on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Elizabeth Glinka
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: kitten rescued from car engine
text: a kitten has been rescued from a car engine this morning after a 10-mile journey around shropshire .
fire crews were called to an address in albrighton after the cat 's owner heard meowing from under the bonnet and they were able to get it out unharmed .
it 's not clear when the kitten had crawled inside , but a vet was on hand to check it over .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: wrong part of patient 's spine operated on at oswestry hospital
text: oswestry 's orthopaedic hospital has published details of an incident in which the wrong part of a patient 's spine was operated on .
board papers say the patient consented to further surgery and the second operation went well .
the report also says the patient appreciated the candour of the consultant who 'd explained what went wrong .
staff say initiatives are in place to reduce the risk of a so-called `` never event '' happening again .

documents.title: headlines : call for 'drastic action ' over a & e delays ; mistake at oswestry hospital ; kitten rescued from car
text: our top stories this lunchtime :
- ambulance service wants `` drastic action '' over hospital a & e delays
- wrong part of a patient 's spine operated on at oswestry hospital
- kitten rescued after being trapped in car engine for 10 miles
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: hospital delays 'need to be sorted sorted in next few weeks '
text: west midlands ambulance service says the problem of delays at the royal shrewsbury hospital needs solving in the next few weeks , before the busy winter period .
it has the longest waits outside a & e in the west midlands and in the last month 122 patients waited over an hour to be transferred to a bed - around 15 % of all patients .
the ambulance service itself is n't blaming the hospital , saying it is constrained by patients it ca n't discharge .
but it said `` something drastic has to happen now '' because if ambulances are tied up at the hospital , they may be unable to get out to emergencies .
despite numerous requests , the hospital trust has yet to comment on the news .
our big concern here is that we literally run out of ambulances .
we end up in a situation in which a 999 call comes in and we have no available resource locally to respond to that call . ''

documents.title: weather : a chance of some sunshine this evening
text: it 's going to be mostly cloudy for the rest of the day , but there is a chance of some sunshine in the early evening .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: in numbers : spending on police informants
text: looking at the police spending on informants around the region , we can see a big variation , depending on the force area .
at one end of the scale , west midlands police spend close to £ 200,000 a year and at the other warwickshire police spend about £ 10,000 a year .
not surprising , given the areas they have to cover - west mercia is one of the lower-spenders , paying out roughly £ 40,000 a year .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: light display to recognise work of stained glass artist
text: if you were in shrewsbury last night you might have seen a light display in the town centre , to recognise the work of a local stained glass artist - margaret rope .
there 's an exhibition of her work at the shrewsbury museum and art gallery at the moment .
and shropshire projection-specialist andy mckeown also wanted to put on a show , to show off some of her best work .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: mp calls for child sex abuse inquiry
text: mp calls for child sex abuse inquiry

documents.title: ice hockey : rare midweek game for telford tigers
text: telford tigers take on guilford flames tonight in a rare midweek game at home , and head coach tom watkins is telling his players not to take their place on the ice for granted .
they can extend their lead at the top of the table to five points with a win and despite scoring 11 goals in the last two games , he believes they are n't scoring enough .
tonight 's game , at telford ice rink , faces off at 19:45 .
it is important that the guys do n't take their ice time in games for granted .
we are fortunate in having a lot of depth in this squad . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: concerns over future funding for ludlow 's maternity unit
text: campaigners have expressed concern that funding for ludlow 's maternity unit is only guaranteed until next march .
about 30 people , including young mothers , met last night .
they 're planning to lobby the ludlow mp and health minister philip dunne and have planned a march in december to show support for the service .
one of the organisers of the meeting , alison hiles , said there was relief the maternity unit had reopened , but called on health chiefs to come to the town , to discuss its long-term future .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: west mercia police spends nearly £ 900 a week on informants
text: west mercia police is spending nearly £ 900 a week on informants .
opinion 's divided on the practice .
some say it 's a cheap way of finding criminals , others think it can lead to corruption .
west mercia police spent more than £ 228,000 between 2011 and 2016 on what it calls `` covert human intelligence sources '' .
the force would n't comment specifically on what the money was spent on or say who else was involved .
for conventional policing issues , such as burglaries and thefts , it 's the most cost-effective form of policing you can do .
but for drugs offences it 's the exact opposite .
it only causes problems .
it makes the monopolies of the organised crime groups grow bigger and quite often the organised crime groups themselves use the system to grass up rivals and expand their business . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : longest ambulance delays in shrewsbury ; telford parents owed £ 6m ; police spend £ 200k on informants
text: our top stories this morning :
- royal shrewsbury hospital has longest delays in region for ambulance hand-overs
- charity says single parents in telford owed more than £ 6m in unpaid child maintenance
- west mercia police spend over £ 200k on informants in five years
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: the new saints : unbeaten now in 15 games
text: it 's now 15 wins out of 15 for the new saints this season , after a 2-0 victory at bangor , last night , saw them through to the semi-finals of the welsh league cup .
rob parry and greg draper scored the goals .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: longest delays for ambulance crews handing over patients in shrewsbury
text: new figures show that the royal shrewsbury hospital has the longest delays in ambulance handovers in the region .
last month , almost 100 patients waited more than a hour to be handed over from ambulance staff , to hospital doctors .
it should take no longer than 30 minutes for the hospital to take responsibility for the care of a patient , but in shrewsbury the longest wait was three and a quarter hours .
telford hospital 's figures were much better , but they 're still the second worst out of 21 regional hospitals .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford mp calls for independent review into child sexual exploitation
text: the conservative mp for telford lucy allan is again calling for an independent inquiry into child sexual exploitation in the town .
in a debate in parliament she said her constituency had the highest rate of such crimes in the country and that the rate is increasing .
the home office says it plans to meet officials in telford to discuss the issue , but has no plans to hold an independent inquiry .
home office minister sarah newton said the situation in telford was improving .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: parents owed more than £ 6m in child maintenance in telford , charity claims
text: it 's being claimed that single parents in telford are owed more than £ 6m to support their children .
figures released today by the gingerbread charity show only three areas of the country have higher amounts of unpaid child maintenance than telford , a record stretching back 23 years .
the charity says money owed should have been collected by the child support agency , which will soon close .
it has called for a change in the system and has asked telford 's mp lucy allan to lobby for improvements to help single parents get the money .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: £ 2m spent on police informants in five years
text: nearly £ 2m has been spent by police forces across the west midlands over the past five years on police informants .
`` covert human intelligence sources , '' as informants are officially termed , provide information on criminal activity .
individual police forces have refused to go into specific detail of how the money was spent , but say it was vital in tackling a whole range of criminal activity .
west midlands police spent £ 1m over five years which is more than double the amount spent by the staffordshire and west mercia forces .
informants are a cost efficent for the police to detect but also prevent crime .
these latest figures really do n't surprise me because the police have been using informants for some time .
i do emphasise this use of informants is highly regulated and it can save the tax payer money in the long run

documents.title: latest : single parents in telford owed more than £ 6m in child maintenance ; ambulance delays at royal shrewsbury hospital
text: the top stories in shropshire this morning :
- single parents in telford owed more than £ 6m in child maintenance , charity claims
- government says no plans for independent inquiry into child sexual exploitation in telford
- longest delays in the region for ambulance crews handing over patients at the royal shrewsbury hospital
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: it will be a cloudy start to the day with the odd spot of light rain , but as the day progresses the cloud will thin , allowing some sunny spells to develop .
in the sunshine it 'll feel milder than yesterday .
top temperatures of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: roadworks causing congestion on one or two roads
text: there are no major accidents to report on the roads this morning , but traffic is slow in one or two places because of roadworks .
there 's slow traffic on the a442 queensway in telford at the shawbirch roundabout .
traffic is also slow because of roadworks on the a49 at astley , between the battlefield roundabout and the astley lane junction .
visit the bbc travel page for more information .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather this morning .
do get in touch if you have a story or photographs you 'd like to share .
you can email , tweet or get in touch via our facebook page .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: enoch powell : a drama out of a crisis
text: enoch powell : a drama out of a crisis
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : a grey end to the day and more cloud tomorrow
text: the cloud is forecast to remain with us for the rest of the day and it should remain tomorrow .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: national honour for shrewsbury curry house
text: a shropshire restaurant has scooped a top prize in a national curry awards .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: hypno-birthing on offer after staff trained in telford
text: telford 's princess royal hospital has started offering hypno-birthing , after 20 midwives were given training .
hypno-birthing uses positive language , visualisation and positive thinking to put people at ease going into labour .
the shropshire smile charity , which was set up to raise funds for maternity units in shropshire paid towards the course , so midwives only had to pay a nominal fee .

documents.title: no more excuses for shrewsbury - hurst
text: no more excuses for shrewsbury - hurst

documents.title: telford mp repeats call for independent child sex inquiry
text: the teford mp has repeated her call for a rotherham-style inquiry into child sexual exploitation in telford .
lucy allan told a westminster hall debate girls were being groomed and traded for sex and that the issue had not gone away despite a high-profile police crackdown .
ms allan said an independent inquiry was needed because even the best councils find it difficult to `` cast a critical eye '' over their own track record .
home office officials are due to meet with telford and wrekin council to discuss the issue , but there are no current plans to hold an inquiry .

an independent review will find out why this happened , it will give reassurance to victims that they will be heard and that they will not be ignored , and it will ensure that all is being done that can be done to stop this happening in the future . ''

documents.title: appeal for help loading aid-container
text: a shropshire group which is preparing to send a container-full of aid to refugees in syria is looking for volunteers to help load it tonight .
shropshire loves says this will be the fifth container it has sent out there , containing winter clothes , prams , toys , food and non-prescription medicine .

it also has 16 tonnes of flour which will need loading into the 40ft ( 12m ) container and that has to be done by hand , so it is asking people to turn up at its warehouse on stafford park 15 in telford from 19:30 tonight .

documents.title: headlines : council spells out hospital review concerns ; family speak of loss ; afc telford united thanks supporters trust
text: our headlines this evening include :
- council says hospitals review is `` flawed , unfair and open to legal challenge ''
- family speak of `` devastating loss '' after death of bridgnorth man in crash
- afc telford united board thanks supporters trust for backing share issue
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: afc telford united thanks supporters trust
text: the afc telford united board have thanked the club 's supporters trust for voting to approve a share issue - and to sell back its own shares to the club .
it says a number of potential investors have come forward in the past fortnight and that if all the shares are sold , it will put the club in a strong financial position .
it says supporters will be able to split the cost of the £ 100 shares and buy them in four monthly installments .
and it expects to release full details in the coming weeks

the football club board view that a full take up of the share offer will put the football club on a strong financial footing , allowing for the investment it requires in the infrastructure of the club to allow the club to be competitive and achieve its declared aim of sustaining national league football . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: severn valley railway to sell shares next week
text: the severn valley railway will be launching a share-offer next week , to fund the redevelopment of its bridgnorth station .
it 's looking to raise £ 2.5m through the £ 1 shares , which will be on sale for 12 months .
the money will pay for a new refreshment room and toilet block for the bridgnorth station , as well as improvements to the track-side pub .
a new turntable for the trains will also be installed and the car park will be improved .
the £ 2.5 million target is ambitious but we understand appetite for the bridgnorth development is extremely strong among existing supporters and we expect this offer to reach new audiences too . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police commissioner learns about body cameras
text: the police and crime commissioner for west mercia has been in london today , learning about body-worn video cameras ,
he 's been getting the thoughts of officers from westminster police , to hear how effective they can be .
west mercia police officers are n't equipped with the cameras , but there has been pressure on the force to start , following the death of the ex-footballer dalian atkinson .
he had been tasered by the police and critics say the encounter should have been recorded .

documents.title: headlines : council 's hospitals review concerns ; family 's loss after fatal crash ; campaigning award
text: our top stories this afternoon :
- council sets out concerns over hospitals review
- family speak of `` devastating loss '' after death of bridgnorth motorist
- campaigning award for llanymynech couple over deepcut mission
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: vets proposed for shrewsbury antiques shop
text: up to 18 new jobs could be created if plans for a veterinary practice get the go ahead .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: your photos : autumn leaves around shropshire
text: there are some beautiful autumnal colours around shropshire at the moment .
these photos were taken in telford ( top ) and norton ( bottom ) by bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : tns look to stay perfect against bangor
text: the new saints will look to maintain their 100 % record when they play bangor city tonight .
it 's the quarter-finals of the welsh league cup , one of three trophies tns won last season .
bangor are third in the league , but are already 15 points adrift of the oswestry-based side .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: council sets out concerns over hospitals review
text: the nhs review of hospital services in shropshire is `` flawed , unfair and open to legal challenge '' according to telford and wrekin council .
it has written to the man in charge of the future fit group , david evans , to set out its concerns about the process and repeating its threat to challenge it through a judicial review .
the authority is unhappy about a nhs non-financial appraisal which recommended downgrading telford 's a & e department and moving women and children 's services to shrewsbury .
it claims the review used a flawed scoring-system and said the information presented to the appraisal panel was n't good enough .
we want to avoid a judicial review if possible .
however , this will depend on how future fit responds to our concerns and if they are certain that their process is fair and legally robust . ''

documents.title: oswestry advertizer front page : smithfield remains an eyesore
text: it 's the gateway to oswestry , it should be the pride of the town .
instead the smithfield site remains desolate and empty as council 's ambitious development plans have fallen by the wayside .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: family 's 'devastating ' loss after fatal crash
text: the family of a man who died after a road crash near newport , shropshire last week say his death is a `` devastating '' loss .
staffordshire police say barry james thomas , 64 , from hermitage close , bridgnorth was driving a vauxhall corsa when it collided with a blue peugeot on the a518 .
in a statement his family described him as `` an extremely caring and loving family man '' and add that he lived for his wife , three children , grandchildren and friends .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : a cloudy start to the day in shropshire
text: the bbc weather watchers have been sharing some dramatic photos of clouds over shropshire this morning and the sun creeping through .
these ones were taken near ludlow ( top ) and dorrington ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: shop closures in the west midlands 'is slowing '
text: the number of shops closing in high streets across the west midlands appears to be slowing down , according to a new survey .
figures from accountancy firm pricewaterhousecoopers show that fewer shops are shutting compared to a year ago .
although the number of closures still outstrip openings , traditional high streets across the region are continuing to fightback against the growth of big online retailers .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: call for support over clifton cinema bank move
text: a business plan on proposals to convert a former bank into a cinema will be complete within the next fortnight .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : the regional impact from heathrow expansion
text: on midlands today this lunchtime we 'll be getting reaction from business leaders in birmingham to the government 's decision to approve a third runway at heathrow .
it 's long been hoped that alongside this project birmingham would be allowed to expand too .
we 'll have more on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: campaigning award for deepcut parents
text: des and doreen james from llanymynech will be given an award by the human rights group liberty this week .
they have spent the last 21 years demanding answers after the death of their daughter , cheryl , at the deepcut barracks in surrey and earlier this year a fresh inquest was held .
liberty said their `` actions bring hope to the families of the other young recruits who died at deepcut . ''
their `` long walk '' award will be presented at london 's royal court theatre tomorrow night .
des and doreen james are remarkable people .

having only ever sought the truth , their extraordinary perseverance has helped shine a light on the brutal and morally chaotic environment at deepcut - serious failings that the authorities wanted to keep firmly behind closed doors . ''

documents.title: headlines : oswestry supermarket criticism ; homes legal challenge date ; award for deepcut campaigners
text: our top stories this lunchtime include :
- criticism over lack of activity at oswestry supermarket site
- date set for legal challenge over wellington development
- liberty campaigning award for llanymynech couple over deepcut tragedy
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: date set for haygate road legal challenge
text: a legal challenge against a decision to grant permission for up to 290 homes on land off haygate road in wellington will be heard on 17 november .
telford and wrekin council had previously refused a developer planning permission , but that was overturned by the planning inspectorate on appeal .
the council is challenging that decision by the planning inspectorate and the hearing will be held in the high court in london .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : grey and cool for the rest of the day
text: it 's going to remain overcast and cool this afternoon , with temperatures around 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: your photos : sunrise from around shropshire
text: we 've seen some impressive photos of the sunrise this morning .
these ones were sent in by bbc weather watchers in ellesmere ( top ) and telford ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : shrewsbury recall smith from barrow loan
text: shrewsbury town have recalled young defender dom smith from his loan at barrow .
he will be available to play against southend united on saturday .

smith has played six times for barrow this season , but has been out of the team recently , with his last game on 24 september , so the shrewsbury manager , paul hurst , felt it was time he came back .
we 've got ryan mcgivern suspended at the weekend .
olly lancashire is out .
a couple of other defenders with knocks that are n't definite for the weekend , so i think we need to look after ourselves . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: ukip 'ca n't afford another mistake ' says mep
text: west midlands mep bill etheridge , who has withdrawn from the party 's leadership contest , says the party has '' really messed things up '' over the past few weeks and it 's now vital they get the right leader .
he called on the other contenders to follow his example and stand down in favour of current deputy leader paul nuttall .
it 's crucial - we ca n't afford another mistake , we 've really messed things up over the last month or two , it 's no secret .
the truth is we have made mistakes and the chance now is to put things right . ''

documents.title: light show to celebrate shropshire artist
text: the work of a largely forgotten shropshire artist goes up in lights tonight .
born in the late 19th century , margaret rope 's stained glass window work can be seen around the world .

international light artist andy mckeown has taken photos of the rope windows at shrewsbury 's catholic cathedral , and tonight he 'll be projecting a stream of images onto the outside of shrewsbury 's museum and art gallery .
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ukip contender bill etheridge quits leadership race
text: one of the eight candidates to become ukip 's leader , the west midlands mep bill etheridge , has pulled out of the contest .

he stated that one of his rivals is `` the only person who can effectively unite our party '' adding that the other contenders should follow his example and stand down in favour of current deputy leader paul nuttall .
he urged ukip to stick to its `` patriotic , libertarian '' principles .
mr nuttall announced on sunday that he would run for leader .
whoever wins the race will replace nigel farage , who is filling the role on a temporary basis .
one of the other confirmed contenders is suzanne evans , the party 's former deputy-chairman , who has a house in shrewsbury and previously competed for the local seat .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: supporters trust says telford have had to change with times
text: over 100 people turned out for an afc telford united supporters trust meeting last night and they voted 98 % in favour of a share issue , to bring new investors into the club .
trust chairman steve bowyer described the moment as `` bittersweet '' because it will mean the end of telford as a fan-owned club .

mr bowyer said the move was necessary because conference football had changed a lot in the past 10 years , with clubs like fylde and salford backed by wealthy investors and some former league sides dropping down .
shares are due to be issued in the `` coming days and weeks '' , he said .
not only have you got the money men , you 've got the likes of stockport county and kidderminster , those sorts of clubs .
before it was very much the traditional non league clubs , now its more former league clubs that have fallen by the wayside . ''

documents.title: criticism over dormant supermarket site
text: morrisons says it is committed to building a supermarket in oswestry amid criticism the site is lying dormant and unkempt .
the supermarket proposals have stalled because developers were expecting a cinema to be built as part of the multi-million pound project .
the original planning conditions said a cinema had to come first , but earlier this year , the chain cineworld pulled out .
that put the 16-acre development in some doubt , but morrisons says it 's committed to exploring all its options .
oswestry town council is in discussion with the supermarket to work something out .

documents.title: headlines : supermarket chain still committed to oswestry site ; west midlands mep drops out of ukip race
text: our top stories this morning :
- morrisons says it is `` committed to delivering a development at the smithfield site '' on the outskirts of oswestry
- one of the region 's ukip meps - bill etheridge - has pulled out of the party 's leadership contest
- telford supporters trust vote in favour of handing over control of the club
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : boosting player morale is hurst 's top priority
text: new shrewsbury town manager paul hurst says one of his first priorities is to improve morale .
the former grimsby boss has been brought in to lift the side from the bottom of league one .
paul hurst says there 's been a fair amount of uncertainty - while there was no-one in permanent charge .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather watchers : a cloudy but beautiful start to the day
text: we 're expecting more sunny spells later this afternoon , but the sun appears to be breaking through already .
thanks to our weather watchers in bicton ( top ) and willey ( bottom ) for these
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: telford fans ' trust votes to hand over control of the club
text: moves to ease afc telford united 's financial worries have been passed .
at a meeting last night , the clubs ' supporters trust voted in favour of giving up control of the club by allowing the board to issue £ 500,000 worth of shares .
five thousand shares at £ 100 each are to be issued to private investors , but under the plans no one is allowed to buy more than a 20 % stake in the club .
it means the football club will no-longer be owned by its supporters trust - paving the way for outside investment .

documents.title: headlines : criticism over dormant supermarket site ; shrewsbury town players ' morale 'needs to improve '
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- morrisons says it 's `` committed to delivering a development at the smithfield site '' on the outskirts of oswestry
- severn trent water is promising to investigate why a pipe burst in prees
- new shrewsbury town manager says one of his first priorities is to improve players morale
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy to start with the odd spot of rain
text: any rain will ease by the afternoon , with some sunny spells later .
charlie has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : no problems so far
text: traffic is moving well across the county , but you may get held up on the a41 around newport .
temporary traffic lights are in place for resurfacing work on the a41 at the a519 .
check local traffic and travel reports for shropshire here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: i 'll be taking a look at the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 've got a story or you want to share , you can get in touch via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that 's it for our live coverage today .
we 'll be back with you from 08:00 on tuesday with more news , sport , travel and weather .
have a great evening whatever you have planned .

documents.title: weather : light cloud to remain for the rest of the day
text: this light cloud will remain with us for the rest of the day and into tomorrow .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: ukip candidate evans describes herself as the 'sensible candidate '
text: ukip leadership-hopeful suzanne evans says people see her as `` the sensible candidate '' who can help the party appeal to the `` mainstream middle ground '' of politics .

the party 's former deputy-chairman , who has a house in shrewsbury and previously competed for the local seat , says ukip has to get more councillors and mps to become a `` party of real influence '' .
she said the party had been misunderstood in the past and wanted it seen its `` true light '' as a `` radical party that most people in britain could really get behind '' .
under her leadership , she said the party would tackle tough issues , but would n't become `` wishy washy and behave like the lib dems '' .

documents.title: plans for 84 homes in wellington
text: the developer taylor wimpey will submit its plans this week for 84 homes on part of the old playing-field at ercall wood school in wellington .
the developer says the houses are `` much-needed '' and will be `` in keeping with the character of the local area '' .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: attacks on ambulance staff double in five years
text: attacks on ambulance staff in the region have almost doubled in the last five years .
west midlands ambulance service trust said the number of assaults rose from 175 in 2012-13 to 298 in 2015-16 .
the situation nationally shows the vast majority of attacks occur on a saturday night just before midnight , and almost three quarters of assaults involved alcohol .
just less than a quarter involved drugs .
mike duggan , a paramedic with the trust , wants to see mandatory sentencing introduced for anyone who assaults a member of the emergency services .
it is disgusting that any ambulance staff , who come to work purely to help people , are subjected to this level of abuse and violence .
despite this , we turn up for duty each shift and continue to provide a first class service to people in their hour of need . ''

documents.title: watch : paul hurst to 'bring fresh ideas ' to shrewsbury job
text: the new shrewsbury town manager paul hurst has been speaking about the challenges facing him and what he hopes to bring to the role .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: farmer says 'little hope ' of catching arsonists
text: a north shropshire farmer , who was targeted by arsonists again at the weekend , says he has little hope of catching the culprits .
adrian marsh from tern hill says the straw he lost was worth around £ 3,000 and its the eighth time he has been a victim in the past 12 years .
mr marsh said his only hope was that they might find a witness , because the fire has wiped the site clean of any evidence .

documents.title: headlines : hurst is new shrewsbury boss ; water pipe bursts investigated ; chinese pot valued at £ 40k
text: our headlines this evening include :
- paul hurst talks about the challenges of becoming shrewsbury town manager
- severn trent to investigate repeated water pipe bursts in prees
- shropshire woman 's chinese brush pot valued at £ 40,000
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: two councils meet over bus-row
text: a meeting will be held this week , aimed at restoring bus services to a number of villages .
from 5 december , the x75 will no longer stop in ford , halfway house and wattlesborough , as it makes its way from llanidloes to shrewsbury .
powys county council funds the service and says it 's taken the decision because shropshire council is no longer subsidising the route .
shropshire council says this is nothing new , because it has n't offered funding for eight years .
